`sigr` formats significance tests.

![](sigr.png)

```{r}
library('sigr')
d <- data.frame(x=1:5)
set.seed(353525)
d$y <- 2*d$x + rnorm(nrow(d))

```

```{r lm}
model <- lm(y~x, d=d)
d$pred <- predict(model, newdata = d)

summary(model)
```


```{r cortest1, results='asis'}
cat(render(wrapFTest(model),
    pSmallCutoff=0))
```
```{r print}
unclass(wrapFTest(model))
```

```{r cortestp, results='asis'}
cat(render(wrapFTest(d, 'pred', 'y'),
    pSmallCutoff=0))
```


```{r ftest, results='asis'}
cat(render(wrapFTest(d, 'x', 'y'),
    pSmallCutoff=0))
```

```{r cortest, results='asis'}
cat(render(wrapCorTest(d, 'x', 'y'),
    pSmallCutoff=0))
```


```{r broom, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
broom::glance(model)
```

```{r modelr , eval=FALSE, include=FALSE
modelr::rmse(model, d)
modelr::rsquare(model, d)
#modelr::mae(model, d)
#modelr::qae(model, d)
```
